Review Title: Poor service and outdated facilities; would not stay again.
Negative Reviews:
As soon as I walked in the door, sweaty with tons of bags on my arms, I was told when I was already far into the lobby that I had to go back outside of the hotel to cleanse my hands. No one offered to grab my bags for me as I did so. I understand there’s a pandemic, but a guest should never be made to carry 100+ pounds of their belongings back outside to access a single hand cleansing station - there could be multiple such stations in the lobby, or the attendants could themselves be armed with some Purell, or at the very least someone could offer to help their guests with their bags.

We were offered “free drink” tickets we were told we could exchange at the bar, but which actually corresponded to two free bottles of water that we had to collect from the restaurant. Typically, a hotel room already has two free bottles of water inside the hotel room itself. This hotel room did not have water. Essentially we were given tickets and made to go to the restaurant to get the two bottles of water that should have already been in our room.

The room is ugly and bland, decorated in dingy shades of brown. It looks as though it hasn’t been re-decorated since the 1960s. The halls are similarly dark and dingy looking.

We were told we could have breakfast at 4am, which was important as we had a 6am flight. We waited until nearly 4:30am and still, half of the food had not yet been put out; there were several empty food containers that hadn’t been filled, so I knew more was meant to come. The only food available was a container of extremely watery scrambled eggs, some bread, and a tray of sliced cheese and ham. Unlike at other hotels where they take your coffee order and offer to make eggs to order, no one addressed us or offered to attend to us as we sat there. Really bad breakfast.

At more than $100 per night, this is an extremely expensive hotel for Lima, and it’s simply not worth it.

Review Title: No hot water and dishonest staff
Negative Reviews: I will tolerate some noise in an airport hotel since the location is obviously going to be busy, but *no hot water*??? We arrived 40 minutes before the 2 pm check in time and were waiting in the lobby for the entire 40 minutes (and, for the record, weren't offered the drink tickets for water from the bar or the wifi password while we waited), so there was ample time to inform us of the problem. No, they waited until after we had checked in and paid for the room and gone upstairs (no one helping us with our bags) to call us on the phone to tell us that the hot water wasn't working but they were working on it. 5 hours later, the claimed it would be fixed in an hour. 2 hours after that, we were told "another few hours." We'd just gotten back from the Amazon, covered in sweat and sunscreen and insect repellant, but we had to go to bed without a hot shower. And the hot water still wasn't working the next morning, so we complained at checkout only to be told, "Oh, but we told you before check in and we offered to cancel the reservation for you." Um, no, they didn't. We asked to speak with the manager only to be told that the manager wasn't in but would get back to us. Never happened. No hot water? Yes, that's a problem, but dishonest staff? Avoid.
